reviewText:
This is my first serious review so i hope it helps:

This game has lots of hate, but those people havent played for even an hour so ignore those,

This game is about a guy in a luch truck just trying to sell food, pretty simple as all you do is manage your money buy new things and simulate the job of a luch truck guy.

Pros:
-Simple and easy to learn
-Lots of different foods and trucks, for more hours of gameplay
-Ajusting the prices (SERIOUSLY every tycoon game needs this!!!)
-Food sells better in certain location, for more challenge
-Food competitions

Cons:
-The music (kindof repetitve]
-Hard to get enough money for new trucks
-This is a casual game, so it might get boring if you play too much in a row.

Suggestions for the developers
-Competition: like lets say, other lunch trucks that might try to sabatoge your company and you can sabotoge them, and buy their company when they go bankrupt!
-Better soundtrack
-Easier to get lunch trucks
I hope you guys (the developers) continue to update this game with more content!

The visuals are simple and nice, the gameplay is fun and easy and its perfect for the people who like simple casual tycoon games

8/10 A great and simple tycoon game for hours of fun!

This 99 cent game is worth every penny!

I've been an avid video-gamer for more than thirty-years, both on PC and console, and I'm a very harsh critic.

reviewText: Lunch Truck Tycoon takes place on a dystopian, late-capitalist island known as Lunch Island; a horrible place where the same 20 second song is played over loudspeakers on loop at all locations. The days pass by in a rushed blur, yet it is always lunch time on Lunch Island. Strictly segregated by socioeconomic class, the island population is comprised of hunderds of silent and exhausted clones stemming from the same 5 or 6 white people and one brown man in a gray suit, creating an uncomfortable and unsettling atmosphere as you see the same person walk past your truck dozens of times per day. Scared of clowns? Get used to it, 20% of the island's economy seems to be from the clowning industry. The insane dictator they call Mayor" will randomly threaten to ban products from lunch island for no reason
recommended: though he seems to have a short attention span and never follows through on his threats
hoursPlayed: whether you successfully rally the island in protest by selling 10 soda's in 3 days or not.\n\nYou COULD pay less than a dollar for Lunch Truck Tycoon
voteText: further funding Mayor's regime of white supremacy and capitalist tyranny
helpfulPercent: or you could play something with just as much
votesTotal: depth for free on any flash game site."

reviewText: This is one of those Tycoon games where you lose interest very quick. In some related tycoon games, you're purchasing ingredients and are trying to get it right so that you can sell better stuff and make more money. For this one, all you are doing is just restocking and selling it; so there is no creativity involved. There are events where you can try to be creative, but even then it isn't fun and it's all guesses. Also, the upgrades are hard to obtain. Not all the upgrades are available, you need to level up in order to unlock them. The food trucks upgrades are all available, but they are very expensive. In this game, it takes forever to get enough money to get a better truck. Getting a better truck doesn't even do anything; all it does is make more room to put food in your truck. The days are short, so you don't make a lot of money. I literally had to way months until I had enough money to upgrade once. There are events so that you can get extra money and it is a huge help, but you are still a bit away from coming close to buying a new truck. I only play about 2 hrs. worth of the game and I think I'm already done. This should have been an online flash game.

reviewText: Update: You can now change prices! :)\nI want to start out by saying... the game isn't THAT bad.Look at this game in the same vein as the classic flash game Lemonade Stand. Like seriously, this game operates in a very similar manner. The problem I have with it though is the fact that you can't change the prices like you could in Lemonade Stand. In LS you'd also have to worry about inventory, having enough without wasting too much money and not wasting money on extra bags of ice if you didn't need it etc etc. This game more focuses on getting more money to buy more menu items and only selling certain items in certain areas and certain days of the week when the right people are coming through. It's less economic management sim and more luck based situational management sim... if you know what I mean. I'm on the fence for recommending this game because it's not that bad but it's not that great. For sake of ease, I'll leave a video to allow you to make a decision.\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n2d1nv40Mtc

reviewText:
For 99 cents, this is a great casual game to kill some time with. If you're into tycoon / management games, this one is a pretty decent bang for your buck. It's not anything spectacular, but I've played worse.

Pros:
-Easy to learn
-Difficulty follows your level perfectly
-Graphics are good for an indie game that costs 99 cents

Cons:

reviewText:
Lunch Truck Tycoon:

A little big game that gets lots of hate because inexperienced people with less than 2 hours need to make a negative review to make themselves feel better.

As an experienced player (13 hrs on record atm) i can say that this game's good. it's simple, well controlable, even though it seems that the gameplay is just made out of waiting, that's not true and there's more to it.

The gameplay consists of:
-Pricing
-Being in the right place at the right time
-Waiting
-Upgrading
-Competing
-Events such as Cook-Offs
-Moneymaking
---------------------------------------------
In case you need help, i made a Beginner's Guide
I spent a lot of time playing this game and i'm still really happy when i'm getting back to playing it again.

Simple, but great. 10/10

Lunch Truck Tycoon is simply an easy time sink. I don't even know if it's possible to fail this game. I must admit that the game has cute graphics and a fairly clear UI, but there is no meaningful game play to back it up. reviewText:
All in all: I don't know.....
When I first started playing the game, I could see the appeal of it. A quick time filling game that I could pick up and put down and progress steadily. Picking it up was easy, but putting it down was slightly harder due to the fact that the exit button did not work, and using Alt+Tab gave me a white screen of death that I could only get rid of by completely shutting down my computer.

PROS:
-----
- Well structured casual game
- Good indie game



CONS:
-----
-Exiting is difficult
-Cook-off hard to win
-No general pattern to which area buys which foods, i.e. no more hot chocolate sold in the ski resort than in the city
-Buying patterns which do exist seem to change during selling challenges, i.e. an area that once bought lots of coffee now buys not as much

All in all I cannot say that I hate this game but at the end of the day I do not feel that I can recommend either. Hey, at least its' only 79p!

reviewText: What can I say about Lunch Truck Tycoon? Well, I guess for one thing, it can be pretty entertaining. My favorite part sometimes is when you get a text about an event, such as a huge dinosaur booger at the museum in the city, or a Justin Bieber concert... like really? I got a good laugh anyway. Some of the cook off's can be pretty challenging especially when you don't always get the feedback you need from the customers, but I suppose you need to be challenged sometimes. Other than that though the gameplay is pretty straight forward. Sell food, keep your truck stocked, buy upgrades, travel to events, buy a better truck, etc. It's a game I think I will get plenty of use out of when I'm between loads of laundry or just looking to kill time.

reviewText:
This game reminds me of a lemonade tycoon flash game I used to play. It seems simple but there are a lot of upgrades and areas to go to sell at. There doesn't seem to be much strategy or depth though.
The competitions are an interesting feature, however they are frustrating. How you do is determined by what numbers you put into three different ingredients. The only feedback you get on how close you are to perfect is from peoples comments as they walk by. However I've sat for 30 seconds without a single comment in a 90 second competition. I've also gone entire competitions without a single comment on one of the ingredients, and only one comment on the other. That makes it impossible to do well.

If you like simple tycoon games you will probably like this. If not pass on it. I'll probably give it another whirl, but I'm not super enthused on it.

reviewText:
Having just bought the game today a couple of hours ago, this review is bound to change as time goes on. This review will act as my first impressions of the game, so if you are looking for an in-depth review, this is not the one.

Ok, so this game is very fun. Yes, it is quite simple, but it is still an amazing game IMO. Working my way up through the truck ladder is a great experience. I'm still currently with the starter truck, but I'm getting close to an upgrade. The gameplay is like Lemonade Tycoon or whatever the game was called. It is very easy to learn how to play, so a long, drawn out tutorial or walkthrough guide is not needed. The pricing component is a very crucial and GREAT part of the game. I have played many tycoon games in my day, and I always felt that a pricing slider/option was needed to make the game great. The developer did a really great job on that part.

Now, yes this game is amazing, but it still has its issues. An options menu isn't currently in the game, and that is a problem for me. A resolution option also needs to be added.
This is a smaller problem for me and many others, but the song is very repetitive and later on down the road, maybe the developer can add more music. But I personally listen to Spotify while I play games like these, so it isn't that big of a deal to me.

Also, I love games with achievements. It makes the playing experience alot better for me. So, in future updates, it would be nice to have achievements.

Great game and idea. Props to you!

reviewText:
This game is a great time-waster and well worth the dirt cheap price if you like to split/dual screen a game while something else going on online.  It's not worth your full attention, but this is a fun game to have on the side while other things are going on.

The player slowly builds up a food truck, unlocking levels, which in turn unlock different foods and tools.  These upgrades are linear, but the progress is rewarding enough.  This is no idle-game, but it's pretty base.  The player preps a day of food sales, picks a location, hits go and the day progresses.  The player needs to pay attention to a virtual cell phone that alerts HOT SPOTS, where sales might be better than the cuurent spot.

Otherwise, the cell phone indicates 2 types of challenges.  A quick or slow response challenge based on a food and degrees of Rock, Paper, Scissor.  For example, if the challenge is to make the best Coffee in town over 4 days, the player manipulates Coffee,  Milk, and Sugar between 0-15.  A winning combination might be 12-3-10, or whatever.  But the player need to pay attention to passersby who offer on-screen comments like, Too much Coffee
recommended:
it is the children's game of "Hotter or Colder."

SUMMARY: This is not a tycoon game by any means.  This is not an idle-game.  It's a weird hybrid that requires attention every 5-10 minutes.  There's nothing to do in the middle.  Only buy of you need a simple-time waster.

"
voteText: true

reviewText:
Delightfully simple and fun to play once you get the hang of it, which doesn't take too long.

An absolute bargain at £0.79.

There are plenty of items and upgrades to unlock as you level up and the difficulty gradually increases as you progress to stop the game becoming too easy or boring.

The challenges/competitions within the game are fun, if not frustrating at times (when barely any hints are given), but are worth participating in for the cash prizes you can spend on upgrades for your truck.

There's an element of strategy involved as different items sell in different locations. You have the ability to control the price of each item (the customers will tell you if they're too expensive) and frequent events will occur in different areas for more business.

I wasn't expecting much for the price but was pleasantly surprised. This is a game that will be taking up a lot of my time for the forseeable future!

reviewText:
It is a small flash style game. That being said, there is need for some consideraton as to how you act in this game.
My minor gripe with this game however is that you do not really make your cash from selling stuff, the big monetary income comes from various challenges given to you. Graphics is nothing special, but they do not need to be either as that is not what this game is about.
Basically you have a certain amount of room in your truck (bigger trucks have bigger storage), and have to decide which goods you want to try to sell. Some stuff sells better in certain locations etc (however why hot beverages sell so well on the beach I do not know).
A fun games for a few hours, nothing special in terms of positive or negative, but for the price it is at, I will say it is worth the cash (way cheaper than a ticket to a movie, and more hours in return).

reviewText: I have only played for a half an hour, but this game is so addicting. My 7 year old daughter loves it, she has helped me gain the third truck already with her guidance on the food competitions and taste tests.  I recommend this game to anybody who enjoys tycoon-esque games. I had several problems getting it started, but later found out that APB:Reloaded, a game which will not run on my laptop, was running in the background for 60 hours keeping this game from downlading correctly.\nI love changing prices when you know there will be a lot of traffic through your spot, and one of the greatest features is unlocking certain items that gain you customer, such as different signs, a PA system, extra help and many more. This game is a little rough around the edges, but the developer really got the tycoon concept nailed down. Also, for 1 dollar how can you pass it up?

reviewText: Lunch Truck Tycoon  -- Recommended with some reservations.  Casual Fun --- yes, the game is engaging on the premise of the lunchtime catering truck that is struggling to establish itself and grow.  The graphics are...average for this sort of game, not bad, but not impressive enough to elicit a nod of approval at first glance.  The figures of the customers are a bit below standard actually, looking more like the inhabitants of the streets of the 'PAPERBOY' Franchise, i.e.... blocky and non-descript.    Most of the gameplay is easy to learn, I was able to grasp the basics in less than 3 minutes.  The Text Instructions that popup at the very beginning of a game make a very direct connection to each area of info on the screen.   No long explanations, but most functions become apparent very quickly.   Overall, an enjoyable title.  Kudos to the designer for a fairly clean, uncluttered game that does what its made to do.            ....now  here comes my ..HOWEVER\n\nHowever  (see I told you it was coming), Lunch Truck Tycoon loses some of its allure from being perhaps too" clingy to the idea of  providing a somewhat 'reaslistic' simulation of the Lunch Truck Catering business.   After 6 hours of playtime
date: my Lunch Truck Persona is still struggling to get to the first lunch truck upgrade.   I have been able to afford three equpment upgrades
recommended: bhut the costs of those pieces of equipment keep placing me further and further away from upgrading my truck  ( and I am only putting into consideration that I am attempting to purchase the FIRST of 6 truck upgrades --- the ultimate Lunch Truck being the 'Lunchinator' at a staggering $195K).   Now... Considering that I am selling chips
hoursPlayed: slices of pizza...cans of soft drinks
voteText: and candy canes
helpfulPercent: I am sure that you start to see the problem.  After six hours of playtime
votesHelpful: I only have $8623.00 saved...  If Lunch Truck Tycoon suffers from a major flaw
votesTotal: it is certainly that it attempts to be much too economically accurate.\n\nWhen I considered submitting this review
votesFunny: I went back to the Store page and noticed something .... interesting.  On the sample pages of In-Game visuals is a 'sample'  of the Inventory Page within the game.   This Invenotry Page is where the player can order more items to re-stock their Lunch Truck
commentsCount: and set prices for the items to be sold.  However on closer inspection at the upper right hand corner of that sample page
column16: I noticed.....  the Designer has obviously been 'doctoring' his/her own game
column17: since the screen shows that He/or She has amassed more than $249
column19: I played for 6 hours... reached level 23
column21: here is a little "Shame on You"  to the game designer for being a bit deceptive about the actual gameplay.   But
column23: but so frustrating in not being able to advance
column24: that its playability is extremely limited right now.  It seems very 'fixable' however
column25: and I certainly hope that the Designer reads this and works to come up with an active solution to this dilemna.\n\nOne other negative to the game is that I am playing on a PC .. using a mouse/keyboard option
column26: and on the MENU Inventory Screen I am unable to scroll
column30: pick a bale of cotton......  until
column31: I got advice from a 12 year old relative that plays Android games a lot
column32: they advised me to treat the screen as if it was a tablet or cellphone needing a 'flick'.\n\nSo by flicking upwards with my mouse I am able to finally see the lower section of higher priced menu items to purchase/resupply.  This made a lot of difference in my gameplay
column33: so I am now editing my review to a positve.. and hoping the Designer can add some other features to spiceup the sluggish gameplay experience.  RATING:  6 out of 10 katanas !!!"
